Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with traces of two added white bands; exterior, slip mostly worn: two vertical lines and row of vertical dots, probably part of a vertical dividing band.
Curator's comments: The lack of interior decoration and the interpretation of the remaining exterior decoration as a dividing band suggests that the sherd belongs in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0207) (phase 2)
